sourceMeaningMnemonic: Into your <radical>mouth</radical> the <radical>leader</radical> shot an <radical>arrow</radical> with an attached <radical>hook</radical> so that they'd be able to see into your <kanji>throat</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Imagine the arrow with its hook shooting down into your mouth and hooking into your throat. Ouch! Now the leader is peering down in there, but you don't know why.
readingMnemonic: From your <kanji>throat</kanji> you hear a voice. Not yours, but one you recognize. It's <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja>! What's that rascal doing down in your throat?
readingInfo: The leader starts to tug <ja>こういち</ja> out of your throat, but he resists. "No, I like it down here, it's dark and damp." The leader gets angry and pulls harder, which hurts! This is your throat, after all, don't you get a say?!
